Legal_Issue: Application of physical presence test vs. life centralization test; procedural fairness in oral examination
Application_Facts: Applicant was short of required 1,095 residency days within four years and failed knowledge tests
Court_Ruling: Citizenship judge's decision was reasonable and procedurally fair
Defendant_Behavior: Citizenship judge applied statutory physical presence requirement and conducted oral examination with prior warning
Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged incorrect application of residency test and breach of procedural fairness
Legal_Standard: Physical presence requirement under Citizenship Act; principles of procedural fairness
Assessment_Factor: Number of days physically present in Canada; adequacy of notice for oral examination
Procedural_Issue: Whether the applicant's legitimate expectations were violated by the oral examination
Evidence_Used: Residency records, test results, notice of oral examination
Application_Basis: Failure to meet statutory physical presence requirement and knowledge test standards
Evidence_Assessed: Duration of physical residence in Canada, conduct of oral examination
Governing_Rule: Applicants must be physically present in Canada for at least 1,095 days over four years; procedural fairness requires adherence to legitimate expectations
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Insufficient proof of required physical residency
Harm_Assessment: No harm found due to lawful and fair process
Cause_Description: Applicant challenged citizenship denial based on insufficient residency and alleged procedural unfairness
Evidence_Handling: Residency data and examination procedures reviewed for compliance
Legal_Provision_Violated: None found; applicant failed to meet requirements under s. 5(1)(c)
Residency_Compliance: Not met; applicant did not fulfill 1,095-day requirement
Evidence_Assessment: Residency duration confirmed as deficient; oral exam conducted lawfully
Decision_Rationale: Statutory physical presence test applies; no procedural unfairness due to proper notice
Decision_Making_Body: Citizenship judge, reviewed by Federal Court
Evidentiary_Issues: Lack of sufficient evidence to prove required physical presence
Legal_Standard_Applied: Reasonableness standard in judicial review; statutory interpretation of residency requirement
